item.value: More than 1,000 different languages are spoken on the continent of Africa.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
The city with the largest population is Shanghai in China. It has almost 14 million inhabitants.
Diamonds are the hardest substance known to man. A diamond is 58 times harder than the next hardest mineral on earth.
The biggest earthquake ever recorded occurred in Chile, in 1960. It measured 9.5 on the Richter scale.
The strongest wind ever recorded wind was on Mt Washington, New Hampshire, USA. It was an amazing 231mph.
China has more than 350 million telephones, the most of any other country. The United States is second with 268 million.
In 1783 Jean Pilatre de Rozier ( a Frenchman ) made the first balloon flight, reaching a peak altitude of about 500 ft, and traveling about 51/2 mi in 20 min.
Opened in 2010, the Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world.
The Universe is about 14 billion years old. The earth is young in comparison, it is only 4.6 billion years old.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903.
The Sputnik 1, launched on October 4, 1957 by Russia, was the first human-made object to orbit the Earth.
In the Summer of 1896 the first modern Olympics was held in Athens, Greece. The 2012 Olympics will be held in London.
The shortfin Mako shark is the fastest fish, it can swim at 50 kilometres per hour. Olympic gold-medal swimmers could not escape even if they tried, they can only swim at 8 kph (5 mph) .
The blue whale can produce the loudest sound of any living animal. The sound can be detected as far away as 530 miles.
A sneeze generates a wind of 166 km/hr (100 mi/hr), and a cough moves out at 100 km/hr (60 mi/hr).
The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. Cheetahs can run much faster than people.
Michael Jackson's 1982 Thriller album is the biggest seller of all time. Over 110 millions albums were sold.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. Mature blue whales can measure anywhere from 75 feet (23 m) to 100 feet (30.5 m) long and can weigh as much as 150 tons.
